content.description:
The route follows a prominant prow up the wall.

P1 = It starts with smooth low angle climbing for 10' and then steepens and passes a tree/shrub on the right 45'. The rock gets broken and a little loose for about 10' as the route traveses slightly left towards another shrub. Climb over the buldge and straight up onto perfect smooth limestone until the Anchors and a small foot ledge.(70-80ft)

P2 = Climb up and right around the prow to a left facing crack up a dihederal. Go right past the crack and climb the clean face up and right through a shallow groove to the anchors.(90ft)

rap the route
content.location: Walk north past the Chuck Chuck route up a small hill when you crest the hill you will see a prow where the cliff band makes a bend to the east. Walk to the base of it and look for bolts.

content.description:
The route is 35m of perfectly featured limestone. The holds are there but subtle and sloping the entire way. The crux is balancing through the delecate slopy moves from clip to clip. The route is wright at 90 degrees, so power won't help you on this one.

Must have a 70m rope to get off this or take to two ropes up.
content.protection: 12 or so bolts leads to chain anchors
content.location: From Seperation Anxiety keep following the cliff band northeast past an owl cove and look for a huge weakness in the band. From the massive weakness the route is maybe 200 feet to the east. It is on a smooth wall that is 115 ft tall, which could house 10 or so more routes easily.

climbs.name: Chuck Chuck, word to your mother

content.description:
The route is still a project, having worked all the moves out, the guess is 13d/14a ish.

The route has 9 bolts up the right side of a blue water streak. The crux's of the route are boken into two. Going from the 3rd clip to the 4th is powerful and bouldery. The second crux is just linking the very sustained route. No move is necessarily harder than any of the others but there aren't any easy moves(except the first clip) on the entire rig!
content.protection: 9 bolts leads to the anchor chains.
content.location: When you meet the wall from the climbers trail keep traveling along the base past the tallest part. You will come up to a cave. just to the left of the cave you will see the streak in the wall and than look for the bolts.
